title: Stranger Me
text:
Stranger Me is the third <a href="studio%20album">studio album</a> by American musician <a href="Amy%20LaVere">Amy LaVere</a>. It was released in July 4, 2011 by <a href="Archer%20Records">Archer Records</a>.
Production.
"Stranger Me" was recorded and mixed at Music + Arts Studio in <a href="Memphis%2C%20Tennessee">Memphis, Tennessee</a> and at The Garden Studio in London, England, with producer Craig Silvey.
Critical reception.
"Stranger Me" was met with "generally favorable" reviews from critics. At <a href="Metacritic">Metacritic</a>, which assigns a weighted average rating out of 100 to reviews from mainstream publications, this release received an <a href="weighted%20arithmetic%20mean">average</a> score of 78 based on 9 reviews. At <a href="AnyDecentMusic%3F">AnyDecentMusic?</a>, the release was given a 7.2 out of 10 based on a critical consensus of 7 reviews.
In a review for <a href="AllMusic">AllMusic</a>, critic reviewer Hal Horowitz wrote ""Stranger Me" is not only a logical title but a demanding and surprisingly successful experiment that challenges both LaVere and the listener, pushing her into edgy, clearly non-commercial areas." Steve Pick of "<a href="Blurt%20%28magazine%29">Blurt</a>" wrote "LaVere's vocals are deceptively lightweight. Her voice is high and thin, but she phrases eloquently and conveys a wide range of emotional conviction throughout all her work." At "<a href="Paste%20%28magazine%29">Paste</a>", Stephen Deusner said LaVere's release is a "well-rounded album."
